column5: March 14 The following bids  mergers  acquisitions and disposals were reported by 2000 GMT on Tuesday:

column4: Jack Ma's Ant march may be worth slowing
column5: NEW YORK (Reuters Breakingviews) - Ant Financial's march may be worth slowing down. A $1 billion offer for MoneyGram from Euronet Worldwide improves on the deal it agreed earlier this year with the payments arm of Jack Ma's e-commerce colossus Alibaba. The interloper is in the rare position of having a couple of important advantages over the deep-pocketed Chinese entrepreneur.

column4: Euronet Worldwide trumps Ant Financial's offer to buy MoneyGram
column5: March 14 U.S. electronics payments provider Euronet Worldwide Inc said on Tuesday it offered to buy money-transfer company MoneyGram International Inc for $15.20 per share  trumping Ant Financial's bid of $13.25 per share.

column4: Reuters Select: The optics of Intel's Mobileye acquisition
column5: Intel is paying more than $15 billion to get into direct competition with Nvidia and Qualcomm to develop driverless systems for automakers. And  as Reuters' Tova Cohen  Ari Rabinovitch and Paul Lienert report  they're paying big to do it: 21 times Mobileye's expected 2017 revenue and 60 times earnings -- high valuations in just about any field  but certainly in this one. Find out why Intel thinks the cost is worth it.

column4: UPDATE 1-Connected or mechanical? TAG Heuer tries to bridge gap with module watch
column5: BRUNNEN  Switzerland  March 14 Swiss watchmaker TAG Heuer  owned by LVMH  sought to appeal to tech geeks and traditionalists alike on Tuesday by launching a connected watch that lets wearers switch between a smart watch head and a traditional mechanical movement.

column4: Israel eyes tax cuts as Intel-Mobileye deal to boost coffers by $1 billion

column4: Japan's Toyota to look at Saudi production as the countries seek closer ties

column5: CALGARY  Alberta  March 13 Shippers have taken up Transcanada Corp's sweetened offer to move natural gas on its Mainline pipeline  the company said on Monday  granting Canada's remote western plays a boost against more easily accessible American counterparts.

column4: Ackman's Pershing Square sells Valeant stake  takes $3 billion loss
column5: BOSTON Billionaire investor William Ackman walked away from Valeant Pharmaceuticals International Inc  on Monday with a loss of more than $3 billion as he sold his entire stake in the struggling drug company after trying to rescue it for some 18 months. | Video

column4: Valeant shares fall as Ackman exit highlights company's challenges
column5: BOSTON Valeant Pharmaceuticals Inc's stock price fell to its lowest level in eight years on Tuesday after the abrupt exit of its biggest supporter put renewed focus on the Canadian company's most pressing problem: raising capital to cut its roughly $30 billion debt pile. | Video

column4: UPDATE 1-Activist hedge fund opposes Walt Disney's move on Disneyland Paris
